Dear St.Ack.
I have now uploaded two files:
HeritrixLauncher.java:  the cla=
ss responsible for executing Heritrix.
Netarkivet-log.txt (logs from a run,=
 where the logging of the
framework package is set to finest.

Will you tak=
e a look at it?
/S=F8ren

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <st=
ack@a...> wrote:
>
> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> 
> > We stop the crawler by c=
alling: crawlController.requestCrawlStop();
> >
> > That used to work in th=
e build we used (from 15th june)
> >
> > The effect is that besides the cra=
wler never ends we don't get the 
> > reports (hosts-report.txt...) files e=
ither (probably because it never 
> > ends ?)
> >
> The Heritrix start/stop=
/shutdown was recently refactored to accomodate 
> multiple instances of He=
ritrix in same 'container' as well as 
> registration/deregistration of Her=
itrix instances and jobs with JMX and 
> JNDI.   This work may have inadver=
tently broken the way you embed
Heritrix.
> 
> Have you tried enabling Craw=
lController to log at level FINE or FINER? 
> Might give clue on why we're =
shortcircuting job shutdown?  But I 
> guessing your usage is bypassing som=
e newly-added deregistrations now 
> necessary letting go of a job. If you =
paste in the code, I can take
a look.
> 
> You might try using the same met=
hods the UI and JMX uses? (See 
> http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archi=
ve/crawler/Heritrix.html#281 
> for listing of published JMX operations or =
checkout the 1.5 JVM's 
> jconsole application to see a 'prettier' listing)=
.  Going via these 
> methods will be safer in the long run.  These publish=
ed methods are
less 
> likely to change over time.
> 
> Sorry for any incon=
venience caused.
> Yours,
> St.Ack
> 
> 
> 
> > best
> > Bjarne Andersen
> =
>
> > S=F8ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:
> > > Sometimes our embedded crawler (u=
sing build 826) never finishes
(only
> > > writes CRAWL ENDING), and then d=
oes nothing
> > >
> > > What could be keeping the crawler from really finis=
hing?
> > > In the same time we experience the NPE in the QuotaEnforcer cla=
ss.
> > >
> > > Could these two problems be related?
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > =
>
> > >
> > >
> > >
